Sci-fi adventure sequel, starring Arnold Schwarzenegger and Emilia Clarke.(n)

programme.title: The Terminator
programme.desc: A cyborg assassin is sent on a murderous mission back in time to the 20th century, where he wreaks havoc while searching for his intended victim - a woman whose unborn son is destined to lead the human race in a war against machines. However, a soldier has also been sent from the future to protect her. James Cameron's sci-fi thriller, starring Arnold Schwarzenegger, Linda Hamilton and Michael Biehn.(n)

programme.title: Eyes Wide Shut
programme.desc: A successful doctor is shocked to discover his wife once harboured feelings for another man and resolves to get even by embarking on an affair of his own - only to end up involved with a dangerous exclusive cult. Stanley Kubrick's drama, starring Tom Cruise, Nicole Kidman, Sydney Pollack and Marie Richardson.

programme.title: To Catch a Thief
programme.desc: A retired cat burglar becomes the prime suspect for a series of robberies carried out in his own distinctive style, and sets out to clear his name by catching the copycat crook responsible. His quest takes him to the Cote d'Azur, where he encounters the demure daughter of a wealthy holiday-maker, and before long the two are drawn together. Alfred Hitchcock's Oscar-winning romantic mystery, starring Cary Grant, Grace Kelly and Jessie Royce Landis.

programme.title: Hell Is for Heroes
programme.desc: A rebellious soldier defies orders to lead two men on a secret attack on a German pillbox, but his mission fails and the other two soldiers are killed. Court-martialled for his actions, he remains convinced his plan was sound and ignores the sentence to make a second attempt at destroying the emplacement. Second World War adventure, with Steve McQueen, James Coburn and Bobby Darin.

programme.title: Dangerous Liaisons
programme.desc: A philandering aristocrat in 18th-century France schemes with his manipulative former lover to seduce a virtuous young woman. As their conspiracy becomes ever more tangled, events take an unexpected turn. Stephen Frears' Oscar-winning drama of sexual politics, based on Pierre Choderlos de Laclos' novel, starring John Malkovich, Glenn Close, Michelle Pfeiffer, Swoosie Kurtz, Uma Thurman and Keanu Reeves.

programme.title: The Sea Inside
programme.desc: Fact-based drama about a fisherman who is paralysed from the neck down in a diving accident. After spending years dependent on others to take care of him, he decides to fight for the legal right to end his own life. Starring Javier Bardem, Belen Rueda and Lola Duenas. In Spanish, Catalan and Galician.

programme.title: Love & Mercy
programme.desc: Biopic of the Beach Boys' Brian Wilson, following the singer-songwriter at two periods in his life. In the 1960s, he is at his creative peak, but haunted by inner demons that take their toll on his mental health. By the 1980s, he is a broken man dominated by a shady doctor, until a new relationship offers him a chance at recovery. Starring John Cusack, Paul Dano, Paul Giamatti and Elizabeth Banks.

programme.title: Psycho
programme.desc: A woman on the run after stealing from her boss ends up at an isolated motel, where the owner's curious relationship with his domineering mother results in murder. Alfred Hitchcock's psychological thriller, starring Anthony Perkins, Janet Leigh, Vera Miles, Martin Balsam, John Gavin and John McIntire.

programme.title: I Origins
programme.desc: A biologist researching the evolution of eyes uncovers shocking evidence that suggests people are reincarnations of the dead - a fact that could have far-reaching consequences for the human race. Drama, starring Michael Pitt, Brit Marling and Archie Panjabi.

programme.title: Sideways
programme.desc: Two middle-aged men embark on a wine-tasting tour in California a week before one of them is due to be married. The groom-to-be is determined to persuade his self-hating, embittered friend to loosen up - while also making it clear he intends to cheat on his fiancee before the week is out. Comedy, starring Paul Giamatti, Thomas Haden Church, Virginia Madsen and Sandra Oh.

programme.title: Love & Mercy
programme.desc: Biopic of the Beach Boys' Brian Wilson, following the singer-songwriter at two periods in his life. In the 1960s, he is at his creative peak, but haunted by inner demons that take their toll on his mental health. By the 1980s, he is a broken man dominated by a shady doctor, until a new relationship offers him a chance at recovery. Starring John Cusack, Paul Dano, Paul Giamatti and Elizabeth Banks.

programme.title: Psycho
programme.desc: A woman on the run after stealing from her boss ends up at an isolated motel, where the owner's curious relationship with his domineering mother results in murder. Alfred Hitchcock's psychological thriller, starring Anthony Perkins, Janet Leigh, Vera Miles, Martin Balsam, John Gavin and John McIntire.

programme.title: The Wild Bunch
programme.desc: Ageing outlaws, bound by a private code of honour and friendship, find themselves at odds with early 20th-century society, and come to realise their era has passed. Hired to steal guns for a tyrannical Mexican general, they instead decide to turn against him. Sam Peckinpah's Western, starring William Holden, Ernest Borgnine, Robert Ryan, Warren Oates, Strother Martin and Edmond O'Brien.(n)

programme.title: Rushmore
programme.desc: A student causes chaos in an exclusive private school with his temperamental nature - and things go from bad to worse when he develops a crush on a teacher. A wealthy but miserable businessman strikes up a friendship with the troubled teenager, but when he also falls for the same woman, all-out war is declared. Wes Anderson's comedy drama, starring Jason Schwartzman, Bill Murray, Olivia Williams and Brian Cox.(n)

programme.title: The Sea Inside
programme.desc: Fact-based drama about a fisherman who is paralysed from the neck down in a diving accident. After spending years dependent on others to take care of him, he decides to fight for the legal right to end his own life. Starring Javier Bardem, Belen Rueda and Lola Duenas. In Spanish, Catalan and Galician.(n)

programme.title: The Necessary Death of Charlie Countryman
programme.desc: A troubled American travels to Romania in the aftermath of his mother's death. He becomes obsessed with a cellist he meets who is concealing a violent past. His efforts to romance her could cost him his life following a run-in with her brutally violent husband. Drama, starring Shia LaBeouf, Evan Rachel Wood and Mads Mikkelsen.(n)

programme.title: Magic in the Moonlight
programme.desc: An English magician who exposes fake psychics is approached by his friend to prove that a medium is a fraud exploiting a wealthy family. As he watches the spiritualist at work, he begins to believe that she is the genuine article, challenging his previously unshakeable scepticism. Woody Allen's 1920s-set romantic comedy, with Colin Firth and Emma Stone.(n)

programme.title: World Trade Center
programme.desc: Fact-based drama inspired by the events of September 11. The film focuses on two police officers who were trapped in the wreckage of one of the Twin Towers while they oversaw the evacuation, and examines the effects of the tragic incident on their families. Directed by Oliver Stone and starring Nicolas Cage, Maria Bello, Michael Pena and Maggie Gyllenhaal.(n)

programme.title: Charlie Wilson's War
programme.desc: A US congressman gets embroiled in a secret mission to provide covert military support to rebels in Soviet-occupied Afghanistan. Before long, he finds unlikely allies in the shape of a womanising CIA agent, a Texan socialite and the president of Pakistan. Fact-based political drama set during the 1980s, starring Tom Hanks, Julia Roberts and Philip Seymour Hoffman.(n)

programme.title: The Birds
programme.desc: A San Francisco socialite takes a shine to a man she meets by chance, and follows him home to a Californian coastal community. Her arrival coincides with a series of mysterious attacks on people by birds, which soon escalates as vast flocks go on the warpath. Alfred Hitchcock's thriller, based on a Daphne du Maurier short story, starring Tippi Hedren, Rod Taylor, Suzanne Pleshette, Jessica Tandy and Veronica Cartwright.(n)

programme.title: Cake
programme.desc: A woman whose son died during a car accident that left her in constant pain becomes obsessed with the suicide of a young mother she met at a support group, and forms a touching friendship with her husband. Drama, starring Jennifer Aniston, Anna Kendrick and Sam Worthington.(n)

programme.title: The Drop
programme.desc: A Brooklyn bartender secretly provides a service delivering shipments of money to local gangsters. His criminal connections lead to his involvement in a robbery that goes disastrously wrong and digs up the long-buried secrets from his neighbourhood's past. Crime drama based on a short story by Dennis Lehane, starring Tom Hardy, Noomi Rapace and James Gandolfini in his final film role.(n)

programme.title: The Commitments
programme.desc: A would-be music producer from Dublin believes he can make it big in Ireland by promoting a top-rate soul band, so he trawls a working-class neighbourhood and auditions unlikely singers and musicians to put together as a group. Alan Parker's urban comedy, based on the novel by Roddy Doyle, starring Robert Arkins, Andrew Strong, Michael Aherne, Angeline Ball and Maria Doyle Kennedy.(n)

programme.title: Carlito's Way
programme.desc: A former gangster is released from jail and vows to go straight, hoping to earn enough money to escape his New York roots - but his misguided loyalty to a crooked lawyer threatens to drag him back into a life of crime. Brian De Palma's thriller, starring Al Pacino, Sean Penn, Penelope Ann Miller, John Leguizamo and Viggo Mortensen.(n)

programme.title: Gloria
programme.desc: A lonely middle-aged woman begins a relationship with a Naval officer she meets in a singles bar. However, while she throws herself wholeheartedly into the affair, she finds her new lover is held back by his past. Chilean comedy drama, starring Paulina Garcia and Sergio Hernandez. In Spanish and English.

programme.title: Diary of a Wimpy Kid
programme.desc: A boy starts a new school determined to be popular and admired, only to find himself instead a target for bullies. He documents his experiences in a journal as he sets out on a series of attempts to gain the respect he feels he deserves - but his every effort ends in disaster. Family comedy, with Zachary Gordon, Robert Capron and Chloe Grace Moretz.

programme.title: Diary of a Wimpy Kid: Rodrick Rules
programme.desc: A hapless youngster faces the daunting prospect of starting a new school year and desperately tries to impress a girl in his class. But as if that weren't enough to contend with, his parents also force him to spend more time with his bullying older brother. Children's comedy sequel, starring Zachary Gordon and Devon Bostick.

programme.title: Voyage to the Bottom of the Sea
programme.desc: An admiral takes charge of an experimental submarine just as the world is plunged into catastrophe. A belt of radiation surrounding the planet has ignited, threatening all life on Earth. The admiral believes he can end the crisis with a well-aimed nuclear missile, but faces an uphill struggle to convince high command that his plan will not lead to more destruction. Sci-fi adventure, with Walter Pidgeon, Joan Fontaine and Robert Sterling.

programme.title: Bridge to Terabithia
programme.desc: Twelve-year-old Jess befriends a new girl at school, and the pair begin to create their own imaginary kingdom in a secret place in the woods to escape the difficulties of their real lives. Unfortunately, a tragedy threatens to bring their fantasy world to an end. Drama based on Katherine Paterson's novel, starring Josh Hutcherson, AnnaSophia Robb, Zooey Deschanel and Robert Patrick.

programme.title: Footloose
programme.desc: A rebellious, hip-swinging student from the city moves to a small religious community, where he instantly clashes with an old-school fire-and-brimstone preacher - who has banned dancing and rock 'n' roll because he considers them immoral. Drama, starring Kevin Bacon, Lori Singer, John Lithgow, Chris Penn, Dianne Wiest and Sarah Jessica Parker.

programme.title: Knight and Day
programme.desc: A woman has a chance encounter with a rogue secret agent, who has been framed as a traitor and is on the run from his own superiors. Realising she is in danger for knowing too much, he kidnaps her and drags her along on his desperate mission to clear his name. Comedy adventure, with Tom Cruise and Cameron Diaz.

programme.title: Filth
programme.desc: A corrupt policeman with a cocaine habit plans to advance his own career by turning colleagues against each other, while also desperately hoping to persuade his ex-wife to take him back. He rapidly loses his grip on reality as the drug use spirals out of control and his web of lies grows increasingly complex. Black comedy, starring James McAvoy, Imogen Poots, Jamie Bell and Jim Broadbent.

programme.title: Sex and the City
programme.desc: Fashion-mad journalist Carrie Bradshaw prepares for her wedding, which is becoming an increasingly lavish affair. However, husband-to-be Big is having second thoughts, while her friends wrestle with personal crises of their own. Comedy, based on the TV series, starring Sarah Jessica Parker, Kim Cattrall, Kristin Davis and Cynthia Nixon.(n)

programme.title: Dunston Checks In
programme.desc: A gentleman jewel thief's pet orang-utan runs amok in a swanky hotel, causing endless problems for the put-upon manager who has enough on his plate trying to ensure the establishment successfully attains a six-star rating. Family comedy, starring Jason Alexander, Rupert Everett, Faye Dunaway, Eric Lloyd and Paul Reubens.(n)

programme.title: Sunshine on Leith
programme.desc: Two soldiers return home to the Scottish port town after finishing their tour of duty in Afghanistan. While they struggle to adjust to life as civilians, the parents of one of the squaddies prepare to celebrate their 30th anniversary in style. Musical featuring songs by the Proclaimers, starring George MacKay, Kevin Guthrie, Peter Mullan and Jane Horrocks.(n)

programme.title: Picture Perfect
programme.desc: An ambitious executive hires a man to pose as her fiance to give her a stable image at work and attract a colleague who is only tempted by unavailable women. However, her fantasy life soon spirals out of control, leaving her unable to tell the difference between fact and fiction. Romantic comedy, with Jennifer Aniston, Jay Mohr, Kevin Bacon, Olympia Dukakis and Illeana Douglas.(n)

programme.title: The Death and Life of Charlie St Cloud
programme.desc: A man who survived the car crash that killed his brother becomes consumed with guilt. Taking a job in a cemetery, he begins seeing visions of his dead sibling and spends every night in the graveyard with him. When an old friend returns, she hopes to persuade him to let go of the past. Drama, starring Zac Efron, Charlie Tahan and Amanda Crew.(n)

programme.title: The Three Musketeers
programme.desc: A hot-headed swordsman sets off to join the King of France's royal guard, and falls in with a trio of former members who have fallen into disgrace. They join forces to defeat a plot to overthrow the king by an English lord who has built a deadly airship. Swashbuckling adventure, with Logan Lerman, Milla Jovovich, Matthew Macfadyen, Ray Stevenson and Luke Evans.(n)

programme.title: Unknown
programme.desc: A doctor on a business trip in Germany ends up in a coma after a car accident. He wakes up to find another man is claiming to be him, his wife does not recognise him and any evidence of his real identity has disappeared. He seeks the help of the woman who saved his life as he tries to find out what has happened. Thriller, starring Liam Neeson, Diane Kruger and January Jones.(n)

programme.title: Hellboy
programme.desc: A thwarted Nazi experiment lands the Allies with an unexpected visitor from another dimension in the form of a bright-red demon. A secretive US government agency fosters the little devil and he grows up to be its crucial weapon against the forces of darkness - but the re-emergence of the sinister wizard Rasputin proves a challenge even for him. Action fantasy based on the comic-book series, with Ron Perlman, John Hurt, Selma Blair and Karel Roden.(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Grandma finally returns home after her stroke, but everyone is so protective of her that she no longer feels she is needed or has a place in the family.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Part one of two. The family mourns Grandpa's death and celebrates his life, while Mary Ellen and Erin become roommates in Charlottesville.

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Nels Oleson storms out after an argument with Harriet. Their neighbours fear they will divorce, and try to get them to reconcile.

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Doc Baker falls in love with Harriet Oleson's visiting niece, but fears his age may ruin his chances of a happy relationship.

programme.title: The Road from Coorain
programme.desc: Biopic of Australian feminist writer Jill Ker Conway, charting her upbringing in a farming community and early experience of the academic world. Starring Juliet Stevenson and Richard Roxburgh.

programme.title: Stolen Innocence
programme.desc: An unhappy, emotionally vulnerable teenager runs away from home and falls for a charismatic ex-convict, joining him as he travels the country on a crime spree. However, her psychopathic companion ultimately takes her hostage, so he can demand a ransom from her parents. Drama, starring Tracey Gold, Thomas Calabro, Bess Armstrong and Nick Searcy.

programme.title: The Wipers Times
programme.desc: In the bombed-out ruins of the Belgian town of Ypres in 1916, Captain Fred Roberts and Lieutenant Jack Pearson discover a printing press and decide to start a satirical newspaper to raise the spirits of the British troops. It proves hugely popular with the men in the trenches - but their superior officers see it as an act of insubordination and subversion and call for a ban. Feature-length factual drama by Ian Hislop and Nick Newman, starring Ben Chaplin, Julian Rhind-Tutt, Michael Palin and Emilia Fox.

programme.title: The Judge
programme.desc: Part two of two. A lawyer defends a controversial judge arrested for soliciting, but soon uncovers a sorry tale involving everything from death and police corruption to an over-ambitious prosecutor. Courtroom drama, starring Chris Noth, Edward James Olmos, Lolita Davidovich and Charles Durning.

programme.title: Cavedweller
programme.desc: A traumatic event forces a woman to head back to her home town and confront figures from her past - including the two daughters and abusive ex-husband she abandoned years earlier. However, her return is met with hostility by those she left behind. Drama, starring Kyra Sedgwick, Kevin Bacon, Aidan Quinn and Sherilyn Fenn.

programme.title: Death in the Shadows
programme.desc: A man becomes convinced that his father is innocent of murdering his mother - despite his conviction in a court of law. Determined to get to the truth, he begins his own investigation, but faces an arduous struggle to ensure the real killer is finally brought to justice. Fact-based thriller, starring Peter Strauss, Henry Czerny and Lindsay Frost.

programme.title: Jonathan Stone: Threat of Innocence
programme.desc: An ex-cop recovering from the death of his wife is accused of a murder he did not commit. He tries to prove his innocence by tracking down the real killer, enlisting the aid of a wealthy socialite. Crime drama, starring Richard Crenna and Beverly D'Angelo.

programme.title: The Babysitter's Seduction
programme.desc: When the wife of her wealthy employer is found dead, unsuspecting babysitter Michelle is drawn into a sinister plot and finds herself being accused of murder by a determined detective. Thriller, starring Keri Russell, Stephen Collins, Phylicia Rashad and Tobin Bell.

programme.title: Deacons for Defence
programme.desc: A black man is pushed too far by the racist abuse and unprovoked violent assaults meted out by white bigots in the 1960s, and organises a defence group to fight back. Fact-based drama, starring Forest Whitaker, Adam Weiner, Jonathan Silverman and Serene Lee.

programme.title: She's Gone
programme.desc: Drama, starring Ray Winstone and Lindsey Coulson as Harry and Joanna Sands, a couple desperately searching for their daughter Olivia, after she disappears while on her gap year in Istanbul. When their investigations into her life in Turkey reveal a tangled web of lies, Harry is forced to battle his own prejudices and preconceptions before he can begin to find out what has happened to his daughter. With Gary Lucy and Emily Corrie.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Part two of two. The family mourns Grandpa's death and celebrates his life, while Mary Ellen and Erin become roommates in Charlottesville.(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Jim Bob falls in love with the Baldwin family's cousin, who is preparing to become a nun. Ben hires an unreliable new employee at the mill.(n)

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Typhoid strikes an unsuspecting Walnut Grove, forcing Charles, Doc Baker and Rev Alden to work together to take care of the community's ailing residents.(n)

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: A travelling medicine salesman arrives in town claiming to be able to heal anything, but he faces condemnation when Mrs Oleson becomes seriously ill. Red Buttons guest stars.(n)

programme.title: Jennifer: A Woman's Story
programme.desc: A shipbuilding magnate dies, and the company's board of directors divides into various factions, each determined to seize full control of the operation. The widow of the dead tycoon is determined to keep the business in the family, and battles against various schemes to take it from her. Drama, starring Elizabeth Montgomery and Bradford Dillman.(n)

programme.title: If Someone Had Known
programme.desc: An abused wife keeps her suffering a secret, but is ultimately unable to take any more and decides to leave him. When he tries to stop her, she kills him in self-defence. Facing a trial for murder, she struggles to convince a jury of his violent treatment. Fact-based drama, starring Kellie Martin, Kevin Dobson and Ivan Sergei.(n)

programme.title: My Body, My Child
programme.desc: A middle-aged Catholic woman becomes pregnant, but her doctor refuses to believe her and prescribes drugs that have unforeseen effects on her unborn child. She must choose between continuing the pregnancy, knowing her baby will be born severely deformed, or having an abortion in defiance of her faith. Drama, starring Vanessa Redgrave and Jack Albertson.(n)

programme.title: In the Arms of a Killer
programme.desc: A rookie homicide cop lands herself in a dilemma after making the foolish mistake of becoming romantically involved with the prime suspect in a drug-related murder case. Thriller, starring Jaclyn Smith, John Spencer, Michael Nouri, Nina Foch and Sandahl Bergman.(n)

programme.title: Wife, Mother, Murderer
programme.desc: A woman desperate to escape her small town roots murders her husband, attempts to poison her child and assumes multiple fake identities, even going so far as to fake the death of one of her aliases and take on the guise of her own identical twin sister. Fact-based drama, starring Judith Light and David Ogden Stiers.(n)

programme.title: Wicked Love
programme.desc: Fact-based drama about a woman found in a car boot after an attempt on her life that leaves her in a coma. As her unfaithful husband and his mistress stand trial, a controversy erupts over whether her life support should be switched off. Starring Rebecca Gibney, Vince Colosimo and Maya Stange.(n)

programme.title: Runaway Father
programme.desc: A woman who has been living in poverty for 20 years following her husband's death learns that he is still alive, having faked his demise so he could abandon his family. She resolves to track him down and force him to accept his responsibilities. Fact-based drama, starring Donna Mills and Jack Scalia.(n)

programme.title: A Christmas Reunion
programme.desc: An orphan yearns to be closer to his ageing grandfather, and his wish is granted after a visit to Santa Claus reveals a few home truths. Drama, with Edward Woodward, James Coburn and Meredith Edwards.(n)

programme.title: The Price of a Broken Heart
programme.desc: A woman learns her husband has been having an affair with his secretary for years and plans to abandon his family for her. The spurned wife responds by suing her husband's lover for $1million under a long-forgotten state law - resulting in a case that has far-reaching consequences for American divorce law. Fact-based drama, starring Laura Innes, Park Overall and Timothy Carhart.(n)

programme.title: Born Innocent
programme.desc: A teenage runaway is sent to a centre for young offenders by her neglectful parents, where she experiences brutal treatment from the violent inmates and uncaring staff. However, one care worker is determined to help her realise her potential and escape her unhappy surroundings. Drama, starring Linda Blair and Joanna Miles.(n)

programme.title: Sharing the Secret
programme.desc: A teenager struggles with bulimia, while her psychologist mother deals with her guilt at not recognising the signs of an eating disorder. Drama, starring Alison Lohman, Mare Winningham and Roxana Brusso.

programme.title: In Defense of Kids
programme.desc: An encounter with a young runaway leads a lawyer to devote her career to representing abused and neglected youngsters. Drama, starring Blythe Danner and Sam Waterston.

programme.title: Courting Justice
programme.desc: After receiving an unfair settlement in court, an angry divorcee hits the books at law school in an attempt to take on the judicial system. Drama, starring Patty Duke and Donnelly Rhodes.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: A family misunderstanding prompts Grandpa to walk out, leaving everyone else in a state of shock.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: John-Boy is accused of stealing a widow's collection of silver to pay for new truck tyres. Richard Thomas stars.

programme.title: The Outsider
programme.desc: Love story focusing on the relationship which grows between a young widow from a religious group and a cold-blooded gunslinger whom she takes into her home after he is wounded. Romantic Western, starring Naomi Watts, Thomas Curtis, David Carradine and Timothy Daly.

programme.title: Wicked Love
programme.desc: Fact-based drama about a woman found in a car boot after an attempt on her life that leaves her in a coma. As her unfaithful husband and his mistress stand trial, a controversy erupts over whether her life support should be switched off. Starring Rebecca Gibney, Vince Colosimo and Maya Stange.

programme.title: A Change of Heart
programme.desc: A happily married woman learns the hard way that her husband has been hiding a dark secret from her - by unexpectedly walking in on him and his lover, another man. Drama, starring Jean Smart, John Terry and Dorian Harewood.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Part one of two. John-Boy tries to revive his hometown's economy by reopening an abandoned mine, while Erin tries to keep her second job a secret.

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Nellie Oleson returns to Walnut Grove, making her adopted sister Nancy run away. Drama, starring Allison Arngrim and Allison Balson.

programme.title: With Savage Intent
programme.desc: An estate agent sets out to track down the mystery assailants who shot and left her for dead at an empty property - only to realise they are men of influence whose prestige will make them hard to convict. Thriller, starring Elizabeth Montgomery, Robert Foxworth, Howard Rollins and Ronny Cox.

programme.title: A Killing in a Small Town
programme.desc: A Sunday school teacher looking for excitement embarks on an affair with a church-going man, leading to a fatal confrontation with his wife - but as the case goes to trial, she realises the odds are stacked against a jury accepting her plea of self-defence. Fact-based drama, starring Barbara Hershey, Brian Dennehy, John Terry and Lee Garlington.

programme.title: This Matter of Marriage
programme.desc: Two female architects run a successful business together, and have remained single. While trying to win a contract from a billionaire, the duo decide to get back into the dating game, and go through their clients, neighbours and the internet in search of Mr Right. Romantic drama, starring Sherry Miller, Leslie Hope, Michael Nouri and Natasha Greenblatt.

programme.title: Jack Reed: One of Our Own
programme.desc: The maverick detective's partner is murdered by a hitman they were investigating and he sets out to bring him to justice with the help of the killer's girlfriend. Thriller, directed by and starring Brian Dennehy. With Susan Ruttan, Charles Dutton and CCH Pounder.

programme.title: Texas Justice
programme.desc: Part one of two. Courtroom drama about a millionaire who falls for the charms of a working class girl. However, when their relationship turns sour, he sets out to exact revenge - and ends up accused of murdering his old flame's daughter and new lover. Peter Strauss, Heather Locklear and Dennis Farina.(n)

programme.title: To Save the Children
programme.desc: Members of a close-knit community are stunned when the pressures of life prove too much for a former police officer, prompting him to snap in violent fashion, building a bomb and holding pupils at a local school hostage. Drama, starring Richard Thomas, Robert Urich and Wendy Crewson.(n)

programme.title: Ride to Freedom: The Rosa Parks Story
programme.desc: Fact-based drama chronicling the life of Rosa Parks, the black woman who famously refused to give up her seat on a bus to a white man in 1950s America. The action prompted a massive outpouring of anger and sparked the rise of the civil rights movement. Angela Bassett, Cicely Tyson and Peter Francis James star.(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: A widow enlists John-Boy's help in her efforts to win the affections of a farm worker who is hoping to settle down.(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: John-Boy catches his friend Yancy Tucker stealing two chickens and agonises over whether to report him. With Richard Thomas and Robert Donner.(n)

programme.title: Just Ask My Children
programme.desc: A couple are wrongly accused of molesting their children, becoming victims of hysterical testimonies and a tough district attorney. Sentenced to 12 years in jail, they are forced to prove their innocence from behind bars. Fact-based drama, starring Virginia Madsen and Jeffrey Nordling.(n)

programme.title: Between Love and Hate
programme.desc: A shy college boy goes to work as a swimming instructor at an exclusive country club during the summer holidays - only to become besotted with the wealthy mother of one of his pupils. Drama, starring Susan Lucci and Patrick Von Horn.(n)

programme.title: Stagecoach
programme.desc: A stagecoach makes a dangerous journey across Apache territory. Among the passengers are a cavalry officer's pregnant wife, a marshal escorting a prisoner to jail, a prostitute fleeing a failed romance and the notorious gunslinger Doc Holliday. Western remake, starring Willie Nelson, Johnny Cash and Kris Kristofferson.(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Part two of two. Erin's secret is revealed, while John, Jim-Bob and Ben are trapped in a cave-in.(n)

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: As word of a new railway station spreads, Walnut Grove residents look forward to the start of building work - until they learn the true cost of the plan.(n)

programme.title: Danielle Steel's Remembrance
programme.desc: A woman struggles to confront the facts behind her mother's murder, including a doomed love affair cut short by the horrors of the Korean War, and a passionate relationship with a high-flying photographer who hides a dark secret. Drama, starring Angie Dickinson, Eva LaRue and Jeffrey Nordling.(n)

programme.title: Danielle Steel's Daddy
programme.desc: An advertising executive's wife walks out, leaving him to raise their children alone - a problem compounded by his mother's death in a car accident. Drama, starring Patrick Duffy, Lynda Carter, Kate Mulgrew and featuring an early appearance by Ben Affleck.(n)

programme.title: Shaka Zulu
programme.desc: Biopic of the African leader, following his rise to power in the 19th century. Driven by an ancient tribal prophecy, Shaka united his people into a bold new nation. Starring Henry Cele.(n)

programme.title: Sex, Lies and Obsession
programme.desc: Fact-based drama, chronicling the struggle of a man to overcome his addiction to sex with the help and support of his ever-loving wife. Fact-based drama, starring Harry Hamlin, Lisa Rinna and Kevin Zegers.(n)

programme.title: I Survived a Zombie Holocaust
programme.desc: Working as a runner on the set of a zombie movie, Wesley (Harley Neville) and a small group end up fleeing for their lives when real-life walking dead monsters take over the production. Guy Pigden directs this horror comedy

programme.title: Patrick
programme.desc: A telekinetic coma patient torments a young nurse while he is subjected to cruel experiments

programme.title: Growing Up and Other Lies
programme.desc: A disillusioned artist plans on leaving NYC, but first wants to walk across Manhattan with his friends. However, the trip doesn't go as planned when he spots his ex-girlfriend and his pals plot to keep him from moving

programme.title: StreetDance 2
programme.desc: After a humiliating defeat, competitive street dancer Ash attempts a comeback by assembling a crew of top dancers from every corner of the globe

programme.title: Don't Blink
programme.desc: Ex-lovers Tracy (Mena Suvari) and Jack (Brian Austin Green) head to a mountain resort with their new respective partners and a group of six friends. As the trip progresses, the local landmarks, animals, and people appear to be progressively being erased from existence with no warning or reason

programme.title: Brand: A Second Coming
programme.desc: In this intriguing documentary profile, comedian Russell Brand is followed on his journey from addict to an activist whose goal is to encourage a worldwide economic revolution

programme.title: Leave the World Behind
programme.desc: Electronic muisc group Swedish House Mafia embark on their "One Last Tour" world tour

programme.title: Inside Comedy
programme.desc: Conan O'Brien; Jeffrey Tambor. Season 4 ends with Conan O'Brien and Jeffrey Tambor being interviewed

programme.title: Spring Broke
programme.desc: The raucous history of the infamous spring break revelries in Daytona Beach, Fla., that began in the early 1960s is chronicled

programme.title: Exists
programme.desc: Prepare to shake with fear as Bigfoot stalks five friends during a camping trip in the East Texas wilderness

programme.title: Mindhunters
programme.desc: A serial killer lurks among the trainees in an elite FBI programme

programme.title: Shooter
programme.desc: A marksman living in exile is coaxed back into action after learning of a plot to kill the president. Ultimately double-crossed and framed for the attempt, he goes on the run to track the real killer and find out who exactly set him up, and why

programme.title: Don't Blink
programme.desc: Ex-lovers Tracy (Mena Suvari) and Jack (Brian Austin Green) head to a mountain resort with their new respective partners and a group of six friends. As the trip progresses, the local landmarks, animals, and people appear to be progressively being erased from existence with no warning or reason

programme.title: The Day
programme.desc: In this claustrophobic, pulse-pounding thriller, a ragtag band of postapocalyptic survivors take shelter in an abandoned farmhouse, but they soon come under siege from forces looking to wipe them out

programme.title: Spring Broke

Elias Koteas, Jason Behr, Natassia Malthe, Kim Coates, Rogue Johnston(n)

programme.title: Drunk Stoned Brilliant Dead: The Story of the National Lampoon
programme.desc: The National Lampoon name has been synonymous with irreverent and outrageous comedy for the past forty-five years. This documentary takes the viewer on a tour through the history of the Lampoon, starting with early years of the magazine (which published its first issue in April, 1970) to its influence on groundbreaking comedy films such as Caddyshack, Vacation and Ghostbusters. For this film, director and former Lampoon illustrator Rick Meyerowitz, collected the best material from the magazines and interviewed Lampoon veterans from the early days to provide a glimpse into the innerworkings of this influential publication(n)

programme.title: Listen to Me Marlon
programme.desc: In this intimate documentary, Marlon Brando's candid audio recordings and home movies reveal a private side of the reclusive actor

programme.title: All Over the Guy
programme.desc: Contemporary romantic comedy about the quest to find the "one" when "the one" doesn't know he's the "one." It explores the unlikely pairing of two 20-somethings thrown together by their respective best friends in hopes of igniting their own romance. They do everything they can to NOT fall in love, but finally they overcome the dysfunction of their parents and surrender to their hearts

programme.title: That Gal...Who Was in That Thing: That Guy 2
programme.desc: This documentary sequel to That Guy... Who Was in That Thing follows sixteen prolific female character actors who discuss their successes and failures in their quest to become Hollywood Stars

programme.title: Seventh Moon
programme.desc: Director Eduardo Sanchez ("The Blair Witch Project") helmed this frightening chiller about newlyweds Yul and Melissa (Tim Chiou, Amy Smart), who arrive in China to meet Yul's family only to have their idyllic getaway take a turn for the worse after they become stranded in a remote village

programme.title: Revolutionary Road
programme.desc: Drama based on Richard Yates's acclaimed novel, reuniting the Titanic stars Leonardo DiCaprio and Kate Winslet. April and Frank Wheeler are a young, thriving couple living with their two children in a Connecticut suburb in the mid-1950s. Their self-assured exterior masks a creeping frustration at their inability to feel fulfilled in their relationships or careers. Frank is mired in a well-paying but boring office job, and April is a housewife still mourning the demise of her hoped-for acting career. Determined to identify themselves as superior to the mediocre sprawl of suburbanites who surround them, they decide to move to France where they will be better able to develop their true artistic sensibilities, free of the consumerist demands of capitalist America. But as their relationship deteriorates into an endless cycle of squabbling, jealousy and recriminations, their trip and their dreams of self-fulfilment are thrown into jeopardy

programme.title: Girl on the Edge
programme.desc: A teen struggles to overcome trauma she endured from a social-media event that also opened old childhood wounds. programme.title: What If
programme.desc: A dropout med student falls for an aspiring animator, but finds that she is committed to her live-in boyfriend. They agree just to be friends, but gradually grow more intimate when her partner is away traveling

programme.title: The Manchurian Candidate
programme.desc: Jonathan Demme's remake of John Frankenheimer's 1962 thriller is updated to the Gulf War, with Ben Marco as a member of a patrol saved by Raymond Shaw. Shaw was awarded the Medal of Honor and is now standing for vice-president under the stern eye of his controlling mother Eleanor. But, unlike in the original film, she's a pawn not of the communists but of big business, who want their own man in the White House. Marco, however, keeps having disturbing nightmares and discovers he is being controlled not by brain-washing but by implanted chips. As he attempts to unravel the mystery and stop Eleanor's plot, so she is equally determined that her son will not be thwarted

programme.title: Wall Street
programme.desc: (1987) Oliver Stone's morality tale stars Charlie Sheen as Bud Fox, an ambitious young stockbroker, who's willing to do whatever it takes to emulate his hero, supremely wealthy financier Gordon Gekko (Michael Douglas). Bud's initial attempts to play the market honestly don't light his touchpaper to success. But, when he passes on some insider information to Gekko, his career starts to pick up pace and, as he becomes increasingly embroiled in illegal trading and financial espionage, he begins to make the money of his dreams. However, he fails to fully comprehend the true cost of his deals until one of them threatens the livelihood of his union boss father (Martin Sheen). Also starring Daryl Hannah and Terence Stamp. programme.title: The Mistress of Spices
programme.desc: Director Paul Mayeda Berges adapts author Chitra Banerjee Divakaruni magic realist tale about an enchanting Indian orphan who has leaned to harness the magical properties of spices. Orphaned by regional strife in her homeland of India, Tilo (Aishwarya Rai) is subsequently kidnapped by a vicious gang of bandits. A daring escape is quick to follow, and soon after washing up on mysterious shores the traumatized girl is sheltered by a benevolent old woman (Zohra Segal) who reveals to her the remarkable powers of common spices. Later, after moving to Oakland, California and opening her own spice shop, Tilo is compelled to follow three strict stipulations is she is to retain her ability to harness these magnificent powers: she must never use the powers for her own gain, she can never venture outside of her store, and she must never make contact with the skin of another person. When a handsome architect (Dylan McDermott) crashes his motorcycle just outside of the shop and the kindly proprietor rushes to his aid, the instant chemistry between the pair soon finds Tilo's resolve put to the ultimate test(n)

programme.title: Making of 'Straight Outta Compton'
programme.desc: A look at "Straight Outta Compton," a 2015 drama that chronicles the history of the hip-hop group NWA in 1980s California. The film stars Jason Mitchell, Corey Hawkins, O'Shea Jackson Jr., Aldis Hodge and Neil Brown Jr., and is directed by F. Gary Gray

programme.title: A Walk Among the Tombstones
programme.desc: A New York City heroin trafficker hires a haunted ex-cop to find the men who abducted and killed his wife. But as the sleuth gets closer to his targets, he realizes that they're much more sinister than he could have imagined

programme.title: Vice Principals
programme.desc: A Trusty Steed. A school evaluator's arrival rattles Gamby and Russell, who cross boundaries with Dr. Brown

programme.title: Magic Mike XXL
programme.desc: Retired male stripper Magic Mike (Channing Tatum) decides to help his friends put on one last show, as the crew embark on a road trip to Myrtle Beach to perform at an exotic-dance convention. Along the way, they brighten the lives of several women, including an aspiring photographer (Amber Heard) and a diva (Jada Pinkett Smith) from Mike's past

programme.title: Shrink
programme.desc: Following a personal tragedy, successful Hollywood shrink Dr Henry Carter sinks into booze and pot addiction as he struggles to deal with his problems and those of his patients

programme.title: Kung Fu Panda
programme.desc: In the Valley of Peace, Po the Panda finds himself chosen as the Dragon Warrior despite the fact that he is obese and a complete novice at martial arts

programme.title: Ella Enchanted
programme.desc: Anne Hathaway, Hugh Dancy, Cary Elwes, Aidan McArdle, Joanna Lumley, Lucy Punch. Family adventure with Anne Hathaway. A young girl, under a spell to be obedient at all times, sets off on a journey to remove the curse and falls for a prince. Dir: Tommy O'Haver

programme.title: Transformers
programme.desc: A teen finds himself at the centre of a battle to save Earth from transforming alien robots in this blockbuster based on the popular toys

programme.title: Real Sports With Bryant Gumbel
programme.desc: A special episode offering a comprehensive portrait of the International Olympic Committee, its impact on international competition and its power and influence. Also: a look at the IOC's role in the turmoil surrounding the games in Rio

programme.title: The Score
programme.desc: Three generations of method acting giants unite for this crime thriller written by Kario Salem and directed by Frank Oz. Robert De Niro stars as Nick Wells, an aging thief whose specialty is safecracking and who is on the verge of retiring to a life of ease, running his jazz club and romancing his girlfriend Diane (Angela Bassett). But before he can ride off into the sunset, Nick is pressured to do one last job by his mentor and business partner, a flamboyant and extravagant upscale fence named Max (Marlon Brando). Max is plotting the heist of the Montreal Customs House, and he's got a man on the inside, Jackie Teller (Edward Norton), a talented but volatile crook who has managed to ingratiate himself with the facility's staff as a fellow employee suffering from cerebral palsy. Jackie bristles at Nick's interference in "his" score, however, and threatens violence when it seems he's going to be cut out of the action. In the meantime, Nick grows increasingly ill at ease about the operation, as it violates his two most important dictums in thievery: always work alone and never pull a job in your own city. The part of Max in The Score was written specifically for Brando by screenwriter Salem, although the improvisational star and his director Oz reportedly clashed during filming

programme.title: Jumper
programme.desc: (2008) Doug Liman's sci-fi thriller stars Hayden Christensen as David Rice, a 'jumper', who can teleport anywhere instantly. He uses his powers to accumulate the wealth for an ideal lifestyle, but finds himself threatened by the Paladins, a shadowy organisation led by Roland (Samuel Jackson), who are dedicated to tracking down and killing jumpers. Rice teams up with fellow jumper Griffin (Jamie Bell) to take on the Paladins and to save his sweetheart Millie (Rachel Billson), who has become an innocent pawn in the battle. Network premiere. Premiere HD Wide

programme.title: The Transporter
programme.desc: For the right price, ex-Special Forces officer Frank Martin will take anything anywhere. He just has three rules: no changes to the plan; no real names; no opening the package... until one package starts to move. Inside it is the beautiful Lai and, although Martin delivers her to the unscrupulous Darren "Wall Street" Bettencourt, his conscience soon gets the better of him and he decides to track down Wall Street and his masters and rescue Lai…

programme.title: Furious 7
programme.desc: In this high-octane thrill ride, a tight-knit gang of street racers must battle the brother of a defeated nemesis and rescue a software genius from terrorists. The film is dedicated to series regular Paul Walker, who died halfway through production

programme.title: Making of 'Jason Bourne'
programme.desc: A look at "Jason Bourne," a 2016 thriller based on novelist Robert Ludlum's character, and the fifth installment in the series. The film stars Matt Damon, Julia Stiles and Tommy Lee Jones, and is directed by Paul Greengrass

programme.title: The Divergent Series: Insurgent
programme.desc: Tris and Four seek refuge outside of the city with the Amity faction. They convene with other Divergents and exiled survivors, and plot to fight back against the warmongering Dauntless and despot Jeanine Matthews

programme.title: Any Given Wednesday With Bill Simmons
programme.desc: Episode 5. No additional information is available(n)

programme.title: Ocean's Thirteen
programme.desc: All-star heist sequel. The remaining members of Danny Ocean's gang regroup to jeopardise the nefarious plans of a businessman who double-crossed one of Danny's old friends. The team plan to ruin the opening of his glitzy Las Vegas casino and hotel by rigging the games and ensuring that every punter goes home with a jackpot(n)

programme.title: Soldier
programme.desc: A hardened soldier of the future is abandoned on a remote planet when a new breed of genetically engineered warriors is introduced(n)

programme.title: Broad Street Bullies
programme.desc: Documentary on the Philadelphia Flyers of the 1970s and the aggressive style of play that won them back-to-back Stanley Cups. Beloved in their home city and despised elsewhere, the Flyers were one of the most polarizing champions in sports. Among those interviewed are Bobby Clarke; Bill Barber; Dave Schultz; Bill Clement; and Gary Dornhoefer(n)

programme.title: The Crew
programme.desc: Burt Reynolds, Richard Dreyfuss, Dan Hedaya and Seymour Cassel star in this comedy about mobsters who come out of retirement for one last job. Facing eviction from the hotel where they live, the guys try to scare off the owners with a staged shooting. But the plan backfires, and a hilarious comedy of errors begins. Carrie-Anne Moss, Jennifer Tilly(n)

programme.title: Breach
programme.desc: Taut and engrossing fact-based thriller featuring tour-de-force performances by Ryan Phillippe and Chris Cooper. Phillippe plays an FBI trainee who is assigned to keep an eye on a fellow agent (Cooper) suspected of selling information to the Soviets. The film is based on the life of convicted spy Robert Hanssen. Directed by Billy Ray ("Shattered Glass"), who co-wrote the script with Adam Mazer and William Rotko. Laura Linney, Caroline Dhavernas, Gary Cole(n)

With an impending attack on London looming and Holloway discovering a conspiracy running from Vietnam to the Mediterranean, he is on a race with time and must solve the case before it's too late(n)

The horror tale is set to take place in Romania during the Turkish invasion as Vlad (Luke Evans) goes to the greatest of lengths to fight for his homeland -- even if it means selling his soul and becoming forever doomed as a creature of the night(n)

programme.desc: When a plane crash claims the lives of members of the Marshall University football team and some of its fans, the team's new coach and his surviving players try to keep the football program alive(n)

programme.title: The Boy Next Door
programme.desc: In this provocative thriller, a lonely, recently divorced teacher has an affair with a much-younger man. However, their relationship takes a terrifying turn as he grows obsessed with her(n)

programme.desc: Vinyl connoisseur Rob is shaken from his daily routine of harassing the customers in his record store and compiling lists of greatest hits when his girlfriend dumps him. A sweet-natured, funny film of tunes, girls and boys

programme.title: Wimbledon
programme.desc: Popular romcom from the makers of Notting Hill. Peter Colt is a low-ranking tennis pro whose misfortune on the court is matched by his bad luck in love. His life is transformed when he is chosen as a wild card to play at Wimbledon, where he meets and falls in love with an attractive young American on the women's circuit. Their love match spurs him on to reach the tournament final, but will his good fortune hold out long enough for him to lift the prestigious trophy?(n)

programme.title: One Night Stand
programme.desc: Joe Bolster. Joe Bolster shares his thoughts on some of life's ironies, including cable TV, wine tasting, auto repairs, car phones, New York City traffic and contact lenses. Taped in Miami Beach(n)

programme.title: Igby Goes Down
programme.desc: A personal tale about a 17 year old misfit boy who tries to cope with his mother's cancer, his father's insanity and the values and expectations of the old money East Coast society. Truly an intellectual, Igby is a modern day Holden Caulfield of "Catcher in the Rye". Unfortunately the world he lives in is far away from the high expectations he holds for it(n)

programme.title: Brewster's Millions
programme.desc: Much to his amazement, third-rate baseball player Montgomery Brewster discovers that he is related to deceased millionaire Rupert Horn. Even more amazing is the fact that Horn has left Brewster his entire $300 million fortune. The catch? Brewster must spend $30 million within 30 days, or he'll be left with nothing(n)

programme.title: Bad Santa
programme.desc: A hilariously criminal Santa finds a measure of holiday redemption when he befriends a troubled kid. The traditional Christmas tale will never be the same after this cleverly twisted, merrily irreverent story of a Santa so bad that he's funny. Billy Bob Thornton stars (in a Golden Globe-nominated role) as Willie T. Stokes, a washed-up, wisecracking department store Santa who is only in the business for the criminal opportunities. Every Christmas Eve this Santa and his ingenious Elf' Willie's midget partner-in-crime Marcus (Tony Cox), crack the store safe and make off with their own holiday stash. But this year Santa and his Elf find their annual heist endangered by a pesky store manager (John Ritter), a savvy mall detective (Bernie Mac), a sexy Santa fan (Lauren Graham) and an 8-year-old misfit (Brett Kelly) who decides to believe that Willie: intoxicated, acid-tongued and felonious as he is, is the real Santa(n)

programme.title: American Pie
programme.desc: Coming-of-age comedy concerning four high-school friends who vow to lose their virginity by prom night(n)

programme.title: Evan Almighty
programme.desc: Follow-up to the hit comedy Bruce Almighty. God appears before a sceptical congressman to tell him that his destiny is to be the modern-day Noah and build an ark capable of withstanding a mighty flood. While the congressman initially struggles to come to terms with his task and begins to question his own sanity, he soon finds himself gathering animals, chopping wood and trying to convince his disbelieving family(n)

programme.desc: Irreverent teen comedy focusing on a college undergraduate who, after being a senior student for seven years enjoying a hedonistic, fun-filled life, finds his wealthy father has cut off his allowance. He is left with no choice but to become a professional party organiser on campus. When an intrepid student reporter writes an unflattering article about him, the young man sets out to prove her wrong, falling in love with her along the way(n)

programme.title: Iceman
programme.desc: A prehistoric hunter, discovered frozen in the Arctic, is revived by doctors. Some scientists want to dissect him but others hope to learn to communicate with him, and in so doing discover what life was truly like for our Neanderthal ancestors

programme.title: Graduating Peter
programme.desc: The life of Peter Gwazdauskas, a student with Down syndrome, is chronicled from sixth grade through high-school graduation. Gerardine Wurzburg directed this follow-up to her Oscar-winning 1992 short "Educating Peter."

programme.title: The Muppet Christmas Carol
programme.desc: Madcap creatures The Muppets lend their very special talents to a very different version of a much-loved Christmas classic, Charles Dickens' A Christmas Carol - with the help of some humans. Michael Caine plays Scrooge alongside Kermit the Frog as Bob Cratchit and Miss Piggy, who gives an unforgettable performance as Emily Cratchit. It's one of the great stories set in the festive season, with its ghosts of Christmasses past, present and future, and the Muppets make it their own in inimitable style. A Christmas cracker!

programme.desc: Thumbelina. "Thumbelina" (voice of Rosie Perez) embarks on a handful of adventures in the South American rain forest. Other voice talent includes Harvey Fierstein (Mrs. Leaperman), Chita Rivera (Katy) and Antonio Sabato Jr. (Mario)

programme.title: Happily Ever After: Fairy Tales for Every Child
programme.desc: Puss in Boots. Set in a Hawaiian village, David Hyde Pierce gives voice to "Puss in Boots," and Dean Cain does the vocals of a troubled young prince who seeks his help. Also: Pat Morita as King Makahana

programme.title: Coraline
programme.desc: Director Henry Selick (The Nightmare Before Christmas; James and the Giant Peach) delivers a deliciously dark stop-motion animated adventure for children who don't mind a scare or two, based on Neil Gaiman's much-praised book. Coraline Jones and her parents have just moved into the Pink Palaces Apartments in Oregon, where they find themselves surrounded by eccentric neighbours, including a pair of ageing burlesque performers. It should be an exciting time, but Coraline's parents are too busy working as horticultural journalists to spend any time with her, so she is deeply bored. That is until she discovers a mysterious door that only appears after dark. Bold and inquisitive, the youngster investigates. She discovers a brightly coloured alternative universe, where her 'Other Mother' has plenty of time to play with her and her neighbours' quirks are charmingly exaggerated; in fact, she's tempted to stay. But all is not as it seems: everyone in the new world has buttons for eyes - and the operation to install them involves knitting needles. And that revelation is just the first of her shocking discoveries about the true nature of her apparent idyll... So, there's definitely good reason for that PG certificate, though children who can cope with the story of Hansel and Gretel shouldn't find anything too disturbing here. Selick's film won great critical acclaim, and scooped festival prizes around the world, as well as picking up an Oscar nomination and winning the 2009 BAFTA Children's Award. Also featuring the voices of Keith David, Robert Bailey Jr and Ian McShane

programme.title: Camp Nowhere
programme.desc: Rebellious teens faced with a boring summer at camp enlist a teacher to trick their parents and create a fantasy getaway

programme.title: Like Mike 2: Streetball
programme.desc: In a slam-dunking, fast-breaking, jamming sequel to the 2002 smash, Jascha Washington plays an undersized, untalented young basketball player who finds a magic pair of sneakers that turn him into a hoops phenom. But after he takes his special high-tops to the blacktop, he realizes that getting to the top of his game could come with a hefty price. Michael Beach, Brett Kelly, Moneca Delain, Kel Mitchell. programme.title: Chimps: So Like Us
programme.desc: As the world's foremost authority on chimpanzees, Jane Goodall is the ideal guide in this heartwarming documentary. The remarkable similarity between humans and chimpanzees is apparent from the opening of the film in the lush forest on the shores of Lake Tanganyika. Here the chimpanzees live -- much like humans -- in family units, make tools, and express complex emotions. Love, jealousy, friendship, and war are all presented, and further blur the distinctions between human and animal. In contrast, the film reveals the shocking conditions under which chimps suffer in research labs. Produced for HBO, Chimps is informative and beautiful, while also being quite strong in its conviction that chimpanzees deserve to live freely in their natural habitat(n)

programme.title: Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix
programme.desc: In this thrilling and action-packed entry, Harry enters his fifth year at Hogwarts and forms a group with his friends called "Dumbledore's Army" to defend themselves against the Dark Arts(n)

programme.title: Hoot
programme.desc: Wil Shriner's family film, based on Carl Hiaasen's novel, stars Logan Lerman as Roy Eberhardt, who, thanks to his father's job, is at his eighth school in six years, this time in Florida. There, he makes friends with Beatrice and Mullet Fingers. Mullet is involved in low-level sabotage to stop a chain restaurant building on a nesting site used by rare burrowing owls and the other two join his in his eco-battle against inept contractor Curly and his greedy boss Muckle(n)

programme.title: The Manhattan Project
programme.desc: A whiz kid constructs a thermonuclear device with the help of his girlfriend after stealing a cache of plutonium from the doctor who is romantically involved with his mother(n)

programme.title: The Black Dahlia
programme.desc: Director Brian De Palma returns to the helm for the first time since 2002's Femme Fatale with this stylish screen adaptation of James Ellroy's novel detailing one of the most notorious unsolved murders in Hollywood history. Elizabeth Short (Mia Kirshner) was a struggling actress looking to make a name for herself in 1940s-era Tinseltown. Unfortunately for Elizabeth, it was her grim fate that would ultimately overshadow anything she would accomplish during her short and tragic career. When police discover Elizabeth's body cut clean in half and with all of her organs missing, ex-pugilist detectives Lee Blanchard (Aaron Eckhart) and Bucky Bleichert (Josh Hartnett) are the men charged with cracking the case and apprehending the killer. This isn't your average murder case, however, and as Blanchard's marriage to Kay (Scarlett Johansson) begins to suffer due to his obsession with the sensational crime, his partner Bleichert discovers a troubling link between the victim and the mysterious Madeleine Linscott (Hilary Swank), a prominent socialite and the daughter of one of the town's most connected key players

programme.title: Making of 'Furious 7'
programme.desc: A look at "Furious 7," a 2015 thriller about a man seeking revenge on the Toretto gang for the death of his brother. The film stars Vin Diesel, Paul Walker and Jason Statham, and is directed by James Wan

programme.title: Black Mass
programme.desc: This riveting crime drama based on true events follows the rise and fall of South Boston gangster James "Whitey" Bulger, who was convinced by an FBI agent to act as an informant against the Italian mob. With his main competition out of the way, Bulger assumes power and becomes a feared crime boss

programme.title: Take the Lead
programme.desc: Liz Friedlander's feelgood movie, based on a real-life story, stars Antonio Banderas as Pierre Dulaine, a dance teacher who takes it upon himself to improve the behaviour of the pupils of an inner city school by teaching them ballroom dancing. Facing their expected reluctance, he gets them on side by demonstrating the sensuality of the tango and soon, even the most rebellious class members, including Rock, are tangoing and fox-trotting in preparation for the big dance competition that is looming

programme.title: Spy
programme.desc: After years of doing work integral to the success of major missions, a deskbound CIA analyst is finally given the chance to go undercover in order to save her missing partner and thwart a global disaster in this uproarious comedy

programme.title: Saving Grace
programme.desc: Two-time Oscar nominee Brenda Blethyn ("Secrets & Lies") is a delight as a respectable Englishwoman who's plunged into debt after the death of her irresponsible husband. To raise money, she and her gardener cultivate a real cash crop---marijuana. It's a joint venture that just might save her country estate. Craig Ferguson, Martin Clunes

programme.title: Kissing Jessica Stein
programme.desc: A delightful romantic comedy about a woman who becomes so disillusioned with dating men that she decides to answer a personal ad that was written by another woman. When the two meet, a tentative, awkward romance ensues

programme.title: Spaceballs
programme.desc: Mel Brooks offers his irreverent and rollicking take on Star Wars and other sci-fi epics in this goofy comedy. The story features such characters as the princess Vespa, her nemesis Dark Helmet, and her hero Lone Starr

programme.title: The Intern

programme.desc: In this millennial screwball comedy, Tracy (Lola Kirke), a mousy college freshman living on her own in New York City meets Brooke (Greta Gerwig), her stepsister-to-be, and is soon entranced by her worldliness and flummoxed by her impulsive nature. Written and Directed by Noah Baumbach

programme.desc: A brilliant scientist builds a device that allows users to teleport to an alternate dimension, but an experiment involving it goes wrong and leaves him and his three teammates with unusual superpowers. The quartet are then forced to work together to battle an enemy from their past

programme.title: Jumper
programme.desc: (2008) Doug Liman's sci-fi thriller stars Hayden Christensen as David Rice, a 'jumper', who can teleport anywhere instantly. He uses his powers to accumulate the wealth for an ideal lifestyle, but finds himself threatened by the Paladins, a shadowy organisation led by Roland (Samuel Jackson), who are dedicated to tracking down and killing jumpers. Rice teams up with fellow jumper Griffin (Jamie Bell) to take on the Paladins and to save his sweetheart Millie (Rachel Billson), who has become an innocent pawn in the battle. Network premiere. Premiere HD Wide(n)

Beloved in their home city and despised elsewhere, the Flyers were one of the most polarizing champions in sports. Among those interviewed are Bobby Clarke; Bill Barber; Dave Schultz; Bill Clement; and Gary Dornhoefer(n)

programme.desc: In this high-octane thrill ride set in a sun-parched, postapocalyptic future, loner Max gets caught up in the plight of a group of warrior women as they flee from an evil despot across a desert wasteland

programme.desc: Nia Vardalos ("My Big Fat Greek Wedding") wrote and stars in this cheery musical farce. She and Toni Collette play two struggling Chicago singers who pose as drag performers in L.A. after they witness a mob hit in Chicago. David Duchovny, Stephen Spinella, Alec Mapa

programme.desc: An ailing baseball scout is given one last chance to prove his competence - and to reconnect with his daughter - on a scouting trip to North Carolina. Drama

programme.title: Pitch Perfect 2
programme.desc: The Barden Bellas are back, determined to enter (and win) an international competition. After a disasterous performance elsewhere, the Bellas have much more to prove if they want to become the best

programme.title: Making of 'Pitch Perfect 2'
programme.desc: A look at "Pitch Perfect 2," a 2015 musical comedy about a collegiate a cappella group that enters an international competition no U.S. team has ever won. The sequel to the 2012 film stars Anna Kendrick, Skylar Astin and Rebel Wilson, and is directed by Elizabeth Banks

programme.title: Transamerica
programme.desc: Duncan Tucker's film stars Oscar-nominated, Golden Globe-winner Felicity Huffman as Sabrina 'Bree' Osbourne, a man who is preparing to undergo the final part of sex change surgery. Until her therapist, who can authorise the final operation, drops a bombshell. As Stanley, she fathered a son, Toby, who is now a teenage male prostitute and in trouble with the law. Before Bree can have the final operation, she must meet up with him and resolve both his problems and her feelings. Bailing him out in New York, she agrees to drive him to L.A. and on the road, they learn about each other as Toby tries to accept both his father... and his mother

programme.title: The Great Santini
programme.desc: A great, but immature marine pilot builds character in his family by ordering them around like a commander, putting them through drills and hounding his sensitive eldest son. Based on actual events(r)

programme.title: Open Your Eyes
programme.desc: An elderly couple in Nepal blinded by cataracts are given the opportunity to see again thanks to a simple surgery, but first they must be convinced to take the long journey to a clinic(r)

programme.title: American Splendor
programme.desc: Harvey Pekar (Paul Giamatti) is a hospital clerk who loves jazz and is in a slightly depressive relationship with Hope Davis. But he becomes famous through his friendship with cartoonist Robert Crumb (James Urbaniak), who takes Harvey's stickman-illustrated musings on his everyday life and turns them into one of America's most successful cult comic books. Shari Springer Berman and Robert Pulcini's film mixes drama, animation and interjections from the real-life Pekar in this genuinely unique Oscar-nominated, Sundance-winning comedy-drama(r)

programme.title: Ballers
programme.desc: Enter the Temple. Spencer pursues a big client who's already represented by a powerful rival; Ricky mulls his next move; Tracy lobbies for a bigger role at work; Reggie feels undervalued by Vernon(r)

programme.desc: Electrifying chronicle of the seminal rap group N.W.A. and their 'hood-to-riches success, tracing their story from the mean streets of mid-'80s Compton to their triumphant battles against censorship

programme.title: As Above, So Below
programme.desc: In this horrifying tale of psychological torment, a group of subterranean explorers encounter terror in the ancient catacombs beneath Paris. As their journey becomes a nightmare, demons from their past strike back with a vengeance(n)

programme.title: Frailty
programme.desc: Actor Bill Paxton made his directorial debut with Frailty. The bulk of the story is told through flashbacks, as a mysterious man (Matthew McConaughey) tells a terrible tale to an FBI agent (Powers Boothe) investigating the "God's Hand" serial killer case. The man grew up in a small town in Texas, where he and his brother lived a bucolic life with their kindhearted widower father (Paxton). One night, the father awakens the two boys, Fenton (Matthew O'Leary) and Adam (Jeremy Sumpter), and tells them he's had a vision, and God has chosen him and his sons to help Him slay demons who walk the earth in human form. He tells the boys they can never tell anyone about this task. Before long, he comes home from work with a list of names that he claims an angel has given to him. He then begins abducting people, bringing them home, one by one, and having the boys watch while he lays his hands on them. After having proven, to his mind, that they are demons and not human, he chops them up with an axe while the boys look on. Young Adam is eager to participate, seeing his family as "kind of like superheroes," while the older Fenton is distraught, believing that his father has lost his mind. He contemplates running away, but is reluctant to leave his little brother behind. Eventually, he goes to the authorities, which results in disaster. As he tells the story, McConaughey takes Boothe out to the public rose garden near his old home, where he claims his brother, the "God's Hand" killer, buried the bodies. Paxton dramatizes the mayhem while leaving almost all of the gore offscreen, and Brent Hanley's script leaves the true motives of several characters unclear until the very end(n)

programme.title: El Beso
programme.desc: A man asks his platonic female friend for an analysis of his kissing style, but his pal is skeptical of the idea(n)

programme.title: Georgia Rule
programme.desc: Jane Fonda, Felicity Huffman, and Lindsay Lohan star in director Garry Marshall's tale of a rebellious young woman who is sent to spend the summer with her grandmother when her frustrated mother fails to find a means of curbing her unruly behavior. Rachel (Lohan) is an out-of-control teen whose reckless drinking, foul mouth, and hysterical fits have become a constant source of embarrassment for her long-suffering mother, Lily (Huffman). When Rachel crashes her car, Lily determines that the only way to tame her savage daughter is to take her as far away from San Francisco as possible. Though Lily had once sworn never to return to the Idaho farm presided over by her demanding mother, Georgia (Jane Fonda), desperation has a funny way of dulling the pains of the past, and it's not long before Lily is packing Rachel in the car and setting out for potato country. Contrary to the common image of the sweet and doting grandmother, Georgia is a stern matriarch whose beliefs in the power of God and a hard day's work stand in stark contrast to the carefree lifestyle of the tempestuous Rachel. An interesting thing happens as the summer wears on, though; despite her initial efforts to disrupt the quiet Mormon community, Rachel's rage is gradually tempered as she learns the value of structure and responsibility. Later, as Rachel's protective walls begin to crumble and she begins to embrace compassion and kindness, the doors are opened for three generations of family to confront the long-buried secrets of their past and finally move forward in the healing process(n)

programme.title: Eagle Eye
programme.desc: Jerry Shaw and Rachel Holloman were complete strangers at the beginning of the day, but that changed the instant a strange woman called to threaten both their lives and the lives of their loved ones. Suddenly forced into a series of increasingly dangerous situations, Jerry and Rachel must now take orders from a woman who's using everyday technology to track and control their every move(n)

programme.title: San Andreas
programme.desc: In this high-octane thrill ride, a helicopter pilot races to rescue his daughter and estranged wife as a series of massive earthquakes devastate California. Meanwhile, a Cal Tech professor attempts to warn other citizens(n)

programme.title: Beauty Shop
programme.desc: Gina Norris is a long way from the Barbershop - she's moved from Chicago to Atlanta so her daughter can attend a prestigious music school, and she's made a name for herself at a posh salon with her cutting-edge hairstyles. But when her egotistical boss takes credit for her work, she leaves the salon with the shampoo girl in tow to open a shop of her own. Gina buys a rundown salon and inherits a motley group of headstrong stylists, a colorful clientele, and a sexy piano-playing electrician. It's a rocky road to fulfilling her dreams, but you can't keep a good woman down(n)

programme.title: My Life in Ruins
programme.desc: A harried Greek tour guide (Nia Vardalos) leads a ragtag group of tourists around Greece with hilarious results in this winning sun-soaked comedy from director Donald Petrie. Along the way, she manages to open their eyes to the wonders of an exotic land, while she herself begins to see the world in a new light. Richard Dreyfuss, Harland Williams, Rachel Dratch(n)

programme.title: My Big Fat Greek Wedding
programme.desc: Young Greek student Nia Vardalos causes uproar in her exuberant but traditional family when she brings home non-Greek new man John Corbett(n)

programme.title: How to Let Go of the World and Love All the Things Climate Can't Change
programme.desc: A look at communities around the world that have been harshly impacted by the effects of climate change. This in-depth documentary also spotlights inspiring efforts to create a greener, more-sustainable existence(n)

programme.title: 27 Dresses
programme.desc: A single woman who has served as a bridesmaid a shocking 27 times wrestles with the prospect of supporting her sister at the altar on number 28, despite having fallen helplessly in love with her smitten sibling's handsome husband-to-be. Jane (Katherine Heigl) has the kind of altruistic traits that everyone looks for in a friend, yet lately the perennial bridesmaid has begun to feel as if something is missing in her life. One night, local newspaper reporter Kevin (James Marsden) spots the devoted bridal attendant racing between receptions in Manhattan and Brooklyn, and quickly surmises that her quirky tale may be just the story to get him off the bridal beat and into the big time. Immediately suspicious of the cynical reporter's motivations, Jane butts heads with Kevin just as her younger sister Tess (Malin Akerman) shows up in town. While Jane has always put the needs of friends and family before her own wants and desires, she's suddenly prompted to reevaluate her priorities when her boss -- with whom she is secretly in love -- falls for her younger sister Tess. When Tess and Jane's boss George (Edward Burns) make plans to marry, the smitten younger sibling mistakenly assumes that her lovelorn older sibling will be happy to take part in the wedding. For as far back as Jane can remember, she has sacrificed her own happiness for the sake of those she holds dearest, but now that her heart has been broken, she's finally found the courage to be honest with herself. Now, as Jane finally comes to terms with her true feelings, her life begins to change in ways she never expected. Judy Greer and Melora Hardin co-star in a romantic comedy scripted by The Devil Wears Prada screenwriter Aline Brosh McKenna and directed by Anne Fletcher (Step Up)(n)

programme.title: Ghost

programme.title: The Longest Ride

The plot centers on the star-crossed love affair between a retired bull rider who wants to get back in the saddle, and an art student preparing to seek her fortune in New York City. programme.title: Born Killers
programme.desc: Two brothers who make their living through murder and theft find that their work gets harder when they tangle with an intelligent young woman in this dark thriller. Siblings John (Jake Muxworthy) and Michael (Gabriel Mann) were raised by their father (Tom Sizemore), a psychopath who drifted from town to town, killing people and taking their homes and belongings when he ran low on money. John and Michael traveled with their dad, and have grown up to follow in his footsteps, though while Michael enjoys his work and takes particular pleasure in raping and murdering women, John has less enthusiasm for violence and prefers to kill only when the circumstances demand it, without developing a close connection with his victims. John and Michael's ways take a disquieting turn when they abduct Archer (Kelli Garner), a clever and attractive young woman whom both men fall for. This situation begins to deeply trouble John, and his half-sister, Gertie (Lauren German), suggests that it's time he gave up his life of crime, though it soon becomes clear she has motives of her own

programme.title: Dragon Blade

programme.title: Zorba the Greek

programme.title: Pretty in Pink

programme.title: Don't Say a Word
programme.desc: This psychological thriller from screenwriter Patrick Smith Kelly reunites him with his A Perfect Murder (1998) star Michael Douglas. Dr. Nathan Conrad (Douglas) is a respected adolescent therapist faced with a nightmarish scenario when his young daughter (Skye McCole Bartusiak) is snatched by Koster (Sean Bean), a criminal with a talent for high-tech surveillance. Conrad learns that the kidnapper is desperate for a critical piece of information known only to Elisabeth Burrows (Brittany Murphy), one of his catatonic pro bono patients. While his wife Aggie (Famke Janssen) remains at home, bedridden due to a broken leg, Conrad races to unlock the secret stored in Elisabeth's fractured mind, while a New York City detective (Jennifer Esposito) inches closer to discovering the Conrads' dilemma. Don't Say a Word co-stars Oliver Platt and Guy Torry and is directed by Gary Fleder, who follows up his suspense smash Kiss the Girls (1997)

As Elizabeth crosses paths with a series of lost souls whose yearnings are even greater than her own -- including a troubled cop , his estranged wife, and an embittered gambler -- their emotional turmoil ultimately helps her gain a greater understanding of her own problems

programme.title: Meet Dave
programme.desc: Director Brian Robbins' sci-fi comedy stars Eddie Murphy as both a man-sized humanoid spaceship and the diminutive captain of the same vessel. When a piece of extraterrestrial technology crash-lands in young Josh Morrison's bedroom, he initially thinks it's a meteorite. But it's actually an alien device designed to drain the Earth's oceans and save its home planet from salt-depleted doom. And when it fails its mission, a team of 100 tiny aliens are sent to complete the job, arriving amid a fireball on Liberty Island. Tenacious cop Officer Dooley is soon on their trail, while the alien crew start to mutiny over their plans to totally dehydrate Earth when they discover that the locals are much less primitive than they'd expected.
